benchmark_details.name: MultiTerraPath Dataset
benchmark_details.overview: MultiTerraPath is a synthetic dataset for evaluating model performance in cost-efficient path planning across multiple terrains, containing 1,000 maps sized 500Ã—500, each with defined traversal costs and obstacles.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a dataset for evaluating the performance of path planning algorithms in diverse terrain environments.

data.source: Synthetic generation of maps and obstacle information as defined in the dataset description.
data.annotation: Automatically generated for traversal costs and terrain descriptions.

methodology.calculation: Calculated as the ratio of improved paths to suggested paths and the proportion of valid paths incorporating LLM-Advisor.
methodology.interpretation: Higher RP and IR indicate better path planning performance resulting from the LLM-Advisor.
methodology.baseline_results: Improvement Ratio for A* and LLM-A* integration with LLM-Advisor achieved up to 82.50%.
methodology.validation: Experimental results validated through comparative analysis with other existing path planning methods.
